item.title: Cursor AI Code Editor Flaw Enables Silent Code Execution via Malicious Repositories
item.description: A security weakness has been disclosed in the artificial intelligence (AI)-powered code editor Cursor that could trigger code execution when a maliciously crafted repository is opened using the program. The issue stems from the fact that an out-of-the-box security setting is disabled by default, opening the door for attackers to run arbitrary code on users' computers with their privileges. "
item.guid: Cursor AI Code Editor Flaw Enables Silent Code Execution via Malicious Repositories||||||Fri, 12 Sep 2025 10:19:00 +0530

item.guid: Critical CVE-2025-5086 in DELMIA Apriso Actively Exploited, CISA Issues Warning||||||Fri, 12 Sep 2025 16:33:00 +0530

item.title: New HybridPetya Ransomware Bypasses UEFI Secure Boot With CVE-2024-7344 Exploit
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a new ransomware strain dubbed HybridPetya that resembles the notorious Petya/NotPetya malware, while also incorporating the ability to bypass the Secure Boot mechanism in Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) systems using a now-patched vulnerability disclosed earlier this year. Slovakian cybersecurity company ESET said the samples were uploaded
item.guid: New HybridPetya Ransomware Bypasses UEFI Secure Boot With CVE-2024-7344 Exploit||||||Fri, 12 Sep 2025 17:20:00 +0530

item.description: A new artificial intelligence (AI)-powered penetration testing tool linked to a China-based company has attracted nearly 11,000 downloads on the Python Package Index (PyPI) repository, raising concerns that it could be repurposed by cybercriminals for malicious purposes. item.guid: AI-Powered Villager Pen Testing Tool Hits 11,000 PyPI Downloads Amid Abuse Concerns||||||Mon, 15 Sep 2025 12:42:00 +0530

item.title: Hugging Face Releases FinePDFs: A 3-Trillion-Token Dataset Built from PDFs
item.description:
Hugging Face has unveiled FinePDFs, the largest publicly available corpus built entirely from PDFs. The dataset spans 475 million documents in 1,733 languages, totaling roughly 3 trillion tokens. At 3.65 terabytes in size, FinePDFs introduces a new dimension to open training datasets by tapping into a resource long considered too complex and expensive to process.

By Robert Krzaczyński
item.guid: Hugging Face Releases FinePDFs: A 3-Trillion-Token Dataset Built from PDFs||||||Mon, 15 Sep 2025 08:55:00 +0000

item.title: Phoenix RowHammer Attack Bypasses Advanced DDR5 Memory Protections in 109 Seconds
item.description: A team of academics from ETH Zürich and Google has discovered a new variant of a RowHammer attack targeting Double Data Rate 5 (DDR5) memory chips from South Korean semiconductor vendor SK Hynix. The RowHammer attack variant, codenamed Phoenix (CVE-2025-6202, CVSS score: 7.1), is capable of bypassing sophisticated protection mechanisms put in place to resist the attack. "We have proven that
item.guid: Phoenix RowHammer Attack Bypasses Advanced DDR5 Memory Protections in 109 Seconds||||||Tue, 16 Sep 2025 12:57:00 +0530

item.title: From Black Box to Blueprint: Thoughtworks Uses Generative AI to Extract Legacy System Functionality
item.description:
Thoughtworks consultants successfully harnessed generative AI to decode legacy systems lacking source code. Using Gemini 2.5 Pro, they accelerated reverse engineering, creating validated "blueprints" of functionality in just two weeks. The pilot showcased AI's potential to drastically reduce time and risk in modernizing opaque systems while balancing speed with validation.

By Matt Foster
item.guid: From Black Box to Blueprint: Thoughtworks Uses Generative AI to Extract Legacy System Functionality||||||Tue, 16 Sep 2025 08:00:00 +0000

item.title: PagerDuty's Kafka Outage Silences Alerts for Thousands of Companies
item.description:
PagerDuty, the incident management platform used by thousands of organisations to alert them to problems on their systems, suffered a major outage itself on 28th August 2025. In a comprehensive outage report, the company detailed the scope of the problem, the customer impact, and how it is working to prevent a recurrence.

By Matt Saunders
item.guid: PagerDuty's Kafka Outage Silences Alerts for Thousands of Companies||||||Tue, 16 Sep 2025 09:00:00 +0000

item.title: Linux Security Tools Bypassed by io_uring Rootkit Technique, ARMO Research Reveals
item.description:
Security researchers at ARMO have uncovered a significant vulnerability in Linux runtime security tools that stems from the io_uring interface, an asynchronous I/O mechanism that can completely bypass traditional system call monitoring. The research demonstrates how attackers can exploit this blind spot to operate undetected by most existing security solutions.

By Claudio Masolo
item.guid: Linux Security Tools Bypassed by io_uring Rootkit Technique, ARMO Research Reveals||||||Tue, 16 Sep 2025 10:00:00 +0000

item.description: AI agents are rapidly becoming a core part of the enterprise, being embedded across enterprise workflows, operating with autonomy, and making decisions about which systems to access and how to use them. item.guid: Securing the Agentic Era: Introducing Astrix's AI Agent Control Plane||||||Tue, 16 Sep 2025 16:30:00 +0530

item.title: Apple Backports Fix for CVE-2025-43300 Exploited in Sophisticated Spyware Attack
item.description: Apple on Monday backported fixes for a recently patched security flaw that has been actively exploited in the wild. The vulnerability in question is CVE-2025-43300 (CVSS score: 8.8), an out-of-bounds write issue in the ImageIO component that could result in memory corruption when processing a malicious image file. "Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited in an
item.guid: Apple Backports Fix for CVE-2025-43300 Exploited in Sophisticated Spyware Attack||||||Tue, 16 Sep 2025 16:36:00 +0530

item.title: New FileFix Variant Delivers StealC Malware Through Multilingual Phishing Site
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have warned of a new campaign that's leveraging a variant of the FileFix social engineering tactic to deliver the StealC information stealer malware. item.guid: New FileFix Variant Delivers StealC Malware Through Multilingual Phishing Site||||||Tue, 16 Sep 2025 18:03:00 +0530

item.title: Amazon Expands Its Programmatic Integration With SiriusXM
item.description:
Amazon is getting serious about streaming audio. Or, to be more specific, it’s getting Sirius. On Tuesday, Amazon DSP announced an expanded integration with satellite radio company SiriusXM.
